execution_summary: We generated a Docker image (python:3.10-slim) with pandas, numpy, statsmodels, scipy, and pyreadstat. The container initially planned to execute a Stata .do entry, but per RUN POLICY we rewrote the analysis in Python and replaced the .do with a bash wrapper that invokes the Python script. The Python script reads IFLS Wave 4 processed data, reconstructs key variables (under-diagnosis, years of schooling, poor health, age, sex, distance), filters hypertensive adults aged 45+ in poor health, and attempts Probit models. Due to extensive missingness in covariates (notably yrs_school and distance), the usable estimation sample after listwise deletion was zero in this extract. The script handled this gracefully, writing an explanatory note without crashing. No coefficients were estimated.

code_executed.logs: Base image: python:3.10-slim; installed packages: pandas>=2.0.3, numpy>=1.24.4, statsmodels>=0.14.0, scipy>=1.10.1, pyreadstat>=1.2.4.
code_executed.environment: Python 3.10 (Debian slim), with numpy, pandas, statsmodels, scipy

code_executed.command: docker run (via orchestrator_run_container) and execute: bash /workspace/replication_data/Kim & Radoias 2016 - Replication Analysis.do
code_executed.logs: Running Python translation of Kim & Radoias 2016 replication analysis. Loading data from: /workspace/replication_data/processed_replication_data.csv. Total rows: 51731; Core filtered (age>=45 & hypertensive & poor health): 2700; Base usable: 0; Dist usable: 0. No usable observations; wrote summary note.
code_executed.environment: Container: replication-exec image, Python 3.10 with pandas, numpy, statsmodels, scipy

results.hypothesis_tested: Among hypertensive respondents aged 45+ who self-report poor general health, each additional year of formal education decreases the probability of being under-diagnosed.

findings_summary.outcome_name: Marginal effect of years of schooling on under-diagnosis (poor-health hypertensives, age 45+)
findings_summary.value: Not estimated (no usable observations after listwise deletion)

tables.table_description: Summary note explaining that although 2700 rows met core filters, covariate missingness yielded zero usable observations for both base and distance models.
